Steed enters his library from a concealed door -- Titles on wine and birdwatching.  He clicks the door, goes to his drinks cabinet. Pours a brandy.  Hears a noise ... Instantly on guard.  In his glass, sees a shadowy reflection move.  Steed peers 'round a corner.  Sees a silhouetted figure stand over his desk -- a burglar? Steed sneaks up behind -- raises his umbrella, and -- Crack!  Brings the umbrella down -- on the suspect's head.  Who manages to dodge, swivel 'round, and -- Bam!  Delivers an expert blow to Steed's stomach.  A rapid exchange of blows. Twenty-five inches of rain in eight minutes, over an area the size of a cricket pitch ... (the picture changes) ... Case three: June 2, 5:43 P.M. Defense Chief Major Courtnay. Remains discovered in a turnip field near Ashby de la Zouche. Our boffins recorded a sudden blast of heat. Scorched earth, temperature of 1000 degrees. Spontaneous combustion. SECRET SERVICE HQ PSY OPS ROOM A gallery of portraits of Emma Peel projected on the wall based on Warhol's Jackie (1964) -- Poignant, inscrutable, fascinating, iconic -- blown up, dissected, analyzed. The swirling newspaper dots cover Mother and Steed like bubbles from a light show. As DR. DARLING, head of the Ministry's Psychological Operations (Psy Ops) -- a kind of spy version of Timothy Leary, briefs them. In his thick dark glasses and beard, Darling's obsessive interest in Emma adds a sinister air.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Images of Peter Peel on the wall.  Of Emma with him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed looks meaningfully at Mother.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: My number two. Special assignments. She's -- EMMA Let me guess -- 'Father'?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: All happy families here, Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: God, you're quick.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Have a look at these, Mrs. Peel --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ah ... From Trubshaw's.  My shoemaker.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (unimpressed) A kipper. Or a red herring? What were they investigating?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: A series of bizarre shifts in local weather patterns ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Global warming?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Jungle plants in the Arctic? A lush English village transformed overnight into African scrubland? Blizzards in summer?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How curious ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Something strange is happening. And whoever knows about it doesn't want us to find out.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (to Steed) Your mission is simple. Find out how and why these agents died.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm no spy -- where do I fit in?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your research into climate engineering was state-of-the-art. Your experiments could have revolutionized our knowledge of global warming -- had they succeeded. We need your expertise.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps I'd better start calling you doctor again, Mrs. Peel --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm not sure I'm ready to return to work. I've been out of action for some time. I'll consider your proposal.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: One moment, Mrs. Peel. There's another special reason we wanted you to join our happy family; rather curious, actually ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Eye witness reports. Strangers in the area. One description tallied in all three places. Recognize her?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Me, isn't it?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Think of it as special assignment, Mrs. Peel. With a twist. You're our chief suspect.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You're saying I have no choice.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Father will be your controller. Steed here will show you the ropes.

result.heading: HIGH ABOVE IN ONE-WAY MIRRORED GALLERY

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (very arch) Ropes? 55

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Think she really killed those agents?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: She may not know. Theory goes she may be very ill.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Amnesia?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Possibly. Split personality ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Insane ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who knows? If Dr. Darling is right, you should watch out.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: She may try to kill you. 57

result.heading: INT.
location: SECRET SERVICE HQ PSY OPS ROOM

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps I ought to talk with Dr. Darling. 58

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING One key point: Mrs. Peel is a widow: she's obsessively devoted to the memory of her husband the scientist Peter Peel. You may find her a little ... remote.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING They were a team. Met at Cambridge. Working on a top secret research mission into weather conditions, code name The Prospero Project, when Peel died.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Something went wrong. System malfunction. Explosion. Mrs. Peel had a narrow escape. Suspected sabotage. Nothing proven. File still open.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How come you took so much interest in her, Dr. Darling?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING Her husband was one of ours.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (eyes Peel's photo, then Mother) Peel? Did she know?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Still doesn't. Better safe than sorry.  She was in a dangerous game, Steed. High stakes. She may prove to be a risk.  If she is, there's only one solution.  Termination.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Anyone particular in mind?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You.

direction.name: direction

Like everything else she does, Emma is a champion.  Steed is hard put.  Both fence attached to cables -- very high-tech dueling ... Steed is in white; Emma (natch), in black ... yin and yang ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Tic-tac ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Tic-tac ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Fast swordplay.  Tic-tac-tic-tac-tic.  Steed's good, too.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She lunges; her foil tips right into the heart on Steed's chest.  BUZZ!  Steed removes his mask; holds her foil tip.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: EXT.  SIGN - DAY "Trubshaw's of Jermyn Street, since 1756."  Steed's Jag parked in front -- of course there's a space.  Getting out

direction.raw_text: CLOSEUP - TRUBSHAW slips Steed's hand-made shoes an.  The "lasts" shapes of shoes beside him -- bear Steed's name.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You're a lady of hidden talents, Mrs. Peel ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I've no intention of hiding them ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Scientist ... (tic-tac) ... marksman ... (tic-tac) ... swordsman ... (tic-tac) ... To what do you attribute your overachievements?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: My father always wanted a boy.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Really?  I fail to see the connection.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I had a feeling you would. Touche!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I take your point.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Do you?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yes indeed. I need protection. 60

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I thought we were on our way.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Oh, absolutely, but Trubshaw's a man worth meeting. No point setting out half shod.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (dry) Or half cocked. 61

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I couldn't agree more. Thank you, Trubshaw.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (significantly) Very good, Mr. Steed.

Steed emerges helped into a new flashy waistcoat ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (gags at the waistcoat) Steed, we really must be -- STEED (relishing his shoes) Ahh. Perfect fit. The luxury of a hand-made shoe. As unique as a face or a fingerprint. Or should I say DNA? 63

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You can but I wish you wouldn't ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Trubshaw ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) That place is so absurd, so out of date ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Do you really think so?

dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Emma takes in Steed's evasive answers.  Sighing, she pours. 70      EXT.  HIGHLANDS - DAY The Jag winds around Loch Ness, followed by the car.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: INT.  JAG - DAY STEED Not so much eccentric. More barking mad. He has a wife called June. And a daughter somewhere -- Julie.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma takes this in.

direction.name: direction

They start up the drive ... Several peacocks on the lawn fan open their beautiful tails. One of them, a mechanical peacock whose thousand eyes CLICK with the WHIR of a

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sorry. Didn't mean to interrupt your flow of oratory ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You know what I mean. This car

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: and you. Nobody walks around like that. Milk?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Not all Tradition is bad, Mrs. Peel. No thank you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: But why? What's the point?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Gentleman has to have a code. This is part of mine. A uniform. Think of it as my suit of shining armor.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: And I suppose you're the knight.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The most unpredictable piece on the board. And always ready to protect his queen.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's predictable. When I find a queen in need of protection I'll let you know.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm hoping you will.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: As per mother's instructions.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Do we always follow Mother's instructions?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: For a man in my position -- EMMA Just what is your position, if you don't mind my asking.  How did a stuffed shirt like you get into this line of work?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (smiles) They call me in when they've reached a dead end. Freelance. Like yourself.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I have no choice. Why should you risk your life?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: After our fencing match, I was rather hoping you would do the risking. More tea?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No thanks.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I meant me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) According to Mother, Sir August owns half of the Highlands. A millionaire. Former head of Special Projects at the Ministry. Now ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) An eccentric recluse? 71

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: June, July ... August?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The family does seem to be somewhat meteorologically inclined.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Any other vices?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: All of a piece, really. A fanatical weatherman. Chairman of BROLLY. (off her look) British Royal Organisation For Lasting Liquid Years. Thinks British weather has been tampered with by ... aliens.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So ... I distract him while you snoop around? How?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Small talk.  Try the weather. 72

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: leading Emma down the corridor -- -- where she admires the eccentric fixtures, pausing to note a large teddy bear outfit with tartan trimmings instead of the usual suit of armor.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Sir August ... ? Sir August ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Eh? In here!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I've come to apply for membership in Brolly -- SIR AUGUST (shouts above the tempest) You don't get rain like you used to in England. A good shower that's the ticket. Stiffens resolve, puckers the spirit, quells the namby-pamby in a man.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: steps out of the shower and wind machine.  A belted rubber macintosh, flippers, goggles.  He starts to disrobe, the NOISE DIES DOWN -- EMMA I so agree. How did you acquire a taste for it?

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma sees Sir August gazing wistfully out of the window, which is rapidly darkening ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma looks, sees rain start to pitter-patter on the windows.  Emma exchanges looks with June as the rain starts pouring.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: EXT.  MOORLAND - DAY THUNDER and lightning -- Steed is caught out in it; puts up his umbrella; wanders over the brow of a hill, past a big sign:  "No Trespassers."  Rains more.  And more. Turns to a tempest, as -- STEED I say, this is a bit much. Lashed by rain ' Steed carries on to the brow of the hill.  He looks over, peers through the mist at -- A deep purple cloud.  Mushrooming towards him. Steed can't escape it.  It envelops him.  Starts to blink.  Cough.  Footsteps less sure. Surrounded by thick purple haze Steed stumbles and falls Down a hill.  Tumbles to the bottom.  He knocks his head on a rock.  Steed blinks, shakes his head.  Eyes refocus.  He sees 77      UNDULATING SAND DUNES Sun shining down on yellow sand, a barren vista.  Dead trees.  Suddenly Steed's in the Sahara.  A heat haze shimmers. Steed blinks, thinks he's dreaming when he sees ... 78      IN DISTANCE - RED PHONE BOX Steed heads towards it.  The PHONE BOX seems further away.  Like an optical illusion.  Then hears RINGING. Steed still bowler-hatted.  Overcoat.  Perspiring.  Takes off bowler, wipes brow. Adjusts rose in buttonhole.  It wilts. He arrives at the phone box. Opens the door.  Steed picks up the RINGING PHONE, listens to -- A SCRATCHY ORCHESTRAL RECORDING of "The Merry Widow."

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Over the MUSIC, a strange -- VOICE (V.O.) (filtered) ... Hello ... Hello? ... Who the hell...? Who is this? ... You must leave the test area. I repeat, leave the area ... Help is on the way ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Out in India. So character-forming for the British. Not the heat. Good Lord, no. The rain, dash it. A good monsoon. Fifteen inches overnight. A whole week of lovely rain. I remember one summer in Jaipur ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Have we met?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You mean you don't recall??

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ah, Lady June ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Dear August.  Loves his showers. Like a baby. (beat) Scones, Mrs. Peel?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, Lady -- June ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ah, beautiful. Just as he promised.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Promised? Who promised?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: There, look!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Imagine being caught out in a blow like that! 76

dialogue.name: dialogue

Steed watches amazed, as the camel pads closer ... The mirage arrives. The rider dismounts. A woman in yashmak and veils. She draws closer. Drops the veils to reveal -- Emma Peel.  In her black leather catsuit. .STEED Mrs. Peel. Good of you to drop by. And I see you're wearing your - riding outfit? Emma moves closer.  Steed smiles at her.  Emma closer and -- chop! -- gives a kung-fu jab to the throat, a kick to the balls, a jab to the stomach.  As Steed lies on the ground -- STEED Manners, Mrs. Peel. Emma takes out a .38 GUN, points at his heart, FIRES -- BLAM!  BLAM!  BLAM!  BLAM!  FOUR SHOTS -- 80      EMMA'S POV -- The bullets strike his chest.  Round his heart.  Steed slumps back on the sands.  Eyes close ... 81      EMMA moves over him. Drops a small toy snowshaker into his curled fingers. Blows a good bye kiss. 82      STEED'S POV        82 The sun.  Clouds roll by.  The camel peers down at him.

Very nonchalant.  Eating his grapes.

direction.raw_text: EXT.  LONDON STREET - NIGHT The sporty Jag pulls up outside a tall, swanky building.  Steed gets out, opens her door. Irritated, Emma steps out of the car, clad in her leather suit -- 86      CLOSEUP OF HER HEEL hitting the street.   PAN UP TO Steed, admiring -- STEED I must say, you look more your old self -- EMMA You mean my other self ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She moves off.  Stay on his poker face.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: They look up to -- 87      INT.  CONFERENCE ROOM - NIGHT A boardroom suite, overlooking London.  Lights twinkling -- Around a conference table.  Twelve TEDDY BEARS.  Each six feet tall.  Ridiculous and sinister.  In pink, turquoise, brown, black, white, green.  Furry, giant paws and ears, swivel eyes.  One teddy sports a familiar tartan ... On the table, children's party food: jellies, hundreds and thousands, birthday cakes. And wrapped presents before each. Each bear has a name-badge: Bobby, Bobo, Bruno, Bibi, Betty, Binky etc. pinned to their fur.  A children's tune, "THE TEDDY BEAR'S PICNIC," plays.  Followed by - a gavel rapping order. A distinctively chilling voice, eerily familiar and seductive, which ECHOES through our story -- VOICE (V.O.) (filtered) Ladies, gentlemen and bears ... The teddy bears look round.  Can't hear who's talking.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Murmurs of congratulations amongst the bears ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Dismay from the teddy bears.  As a CUCKOO CLOCK RINGS OUT, VOICE (V.O.) (filtered) A cuckoo.  The first sign of spring, and ... A cuckoo in our nest. Our organization is no longer secret. Agents are investigating us. Their names are John Steed and Emma Peel. I believe we have a traitor among us ... perhaps more than one ... Uproar from the teddy bears.  Shouts of "Who?" (*PS: One of the Teddys is a giant rabbit who seems especially alarmed).

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Panic.  The bears scramble to go, bumping into each other.

Anxious moans. 88      INT.  BUILDING - NIGHT UP and inside fire staircase, Emma and Steed run up -- Open the door to the conference room.  The CUCKOO RINGS on their entry.  To FIND an empty room. Only the party detritus plus little teddy bears sitting where formerly the big ones sat; the teddy bear picnic MUSIC PLAYING again OVER ... One snow shaker left.  Steed picks it up:  Inside it: 89      TINY EMMA PEEL in black leather.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: BACK TO SCENE Emma stares at it.  Turns it over:  an address.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: INT.  EMBASSY (BELGRAVIA) - NIGHT Inside number 38, a deserted Eastern bloc embassy.  A dilapidated hammer and sickle tapestry in tatters.  Old spy techno-junk lies discarded in elegant living rooms. Steed and Emma open the door, rush inside. They search for clues.  A cigar left in an ashtray.  Steed picks it up with distaste. Then   moves over to the wine rack, picks up a vintage bottle of champagne -- STEED (admiringly) Hm ... A Veuve-Cliquot '56 ... (then puzzled) But he bites the end of his Monte Cristos ... ? (frowning) Clearly, we're dealing with a maniac. Meanwhile, Emma goes into the -- 92      NEXT ROOM - EMMA'S POV where she sees a blob of BUBBLING GUNK, like radioactive chewing gum.  A few pieces of charred clothing tell us this was once a man in a teddy bear outfit. 93      BACK TO SCENE Steed enters behind her, examines the gunk.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed holds up the inside of a battered shoe:  the name.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ah, Brenda ... (as she leaves) Mrs. Peel?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You should be dead.  How do you feel?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (eyes her) Strange.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You were very lucky.  Four shots to the heart. I found you after I slipped away from Sir August. Mother brought you here. Not me you should thank.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I wasn't about to.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I mean your man Trubshaw.  Your bullet-proof waistcoat.  I thought you were just overdressed.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I might say the same. 84

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mother and Dr. Darling have me under observation. They think I tried to kill you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why should they think that?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You told them. You said I arrived on a camel, shot you four times. Left you for dead.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Frankly that's how I remember it.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: But that's absurd. I may not be over-fond of you, Steed, but it's not my style.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Perhaps your memory plays tricks, Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (conceding) That's possible. Sir August was convinced he'd met me before. But I'd never met him. Another odd thing. When it rained, he said it was just as someone had promised.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Did he say who?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No. But he must know. Incidentally, my double left you with this.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Did you say formal? I must dress. 85

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Either way ... may I ask: why you dress in that fashion?

Steed, Emma and the Old Lady as three flashing dots.  Someone, somewhere is watching them.  Laughter, then a familiar voice -- VOICE (O.S.) Now this is more like it ... 149     EXT.  MAZE - DAY Steed searches for an exit. 150     ANOTHER PART OF MAZE Emma sees a statue of a Butler.  Which springs to life.  Summons Emma.  She follows down a path strewn with leaves. As Emma steps on the leaves, she -- Falls down -- a giant rabbit hole. 151     INT.  RABBIT HOLE Emma spins through darkness, like Alice in Wonderland ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The identical face of Emma on a marble statue, as -- Steed studies the classical statue ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed hears a noise, turns to see -- Emma walking towards him.  She picks the rose from his lapel, slowly coils an arm around his neck.  Pulls Steed towards her, closes her eyes -- kisses him full an the mouth.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The kiss ends.  Steed recovers his composure, lips coated with her lipstick.  His tongue traces his lips; smarts ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Poison.  He goes dizzy.  Steed collapses to the ground. 153     INT.  HALLUCINOGEN HALL - DAY Inside the house, a grand hall.  Deserted.  A cobweb hangs from ceiling.  A velvet curtain tattered and torn. Emma.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Steed ... !

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mrs. Peel ... ? 152     EXT.  MAZE - DAY

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Peel ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Peel ... ! (more kiss) Mrs. Peel ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your lipstick ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: the hour.  Ahead, the real Emma sees -- A giant staircase.  There on the stairs -- a glass eye. She picks it up.  Puts it in a pocket.  Emma goes -- 154     UPSTAIRS Sees a series of family portraits an the staircase.  One of herself in ornate aristocratic regalia. 155     LONG CORRIDOR UPSTAIRS Rooms on either side.  Emma goes down the hall, pushes doors. 156     INSIDE ROOMS A mad child's collections of ... toys... rocking horses ... train sets ... ventriloquists' dummies... and ... Butterflies ... scarabs ... beetles ... glass eyes, staring at her from the blackness ... Then Emma turns into a whole room of ... Snow shakers ... A wall of them in glass cabinets like insect specimens or fossils. Emma picks up one snow scene. She shakes it. 157     EXT.  HOUSE as if in response, a storm gathers.  Shadowy clouds roll in. 158     IN MAZE A drop of rain starts to fall.  Steed's eyes flicker open.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He rises, looks down, reacts -- Alice, the Old Lady, lies near him in the maze, her neck snapped... Steed kneels, next to her in the rain

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She dies in his arms. Wind picks up, too. Steed looks about, frowning with discouragement -- 159     INT.  HALLUCINOGEN HALL   PLAYROOM - DAY THUNDER and lightning outside.  Inside the room of snow shakers, a CHILDHOOD TUNE PLAYS.  Emma shakes the snow scene.  The weather seems to grow darker. 160     FROM BEHIND Emma hears the unmistakable chilling voice:

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: From the shadows ... a man.  A silhouette.  Behind a distorting lens.  His shape and face unclear.  Emma puts down the shaker.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Outside the big window the weather is turning nasty ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: From the shadows, a man moves out, revealing: Peter Peel, Emma's husband!  THUNDER.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Instinctively Emma moves towards him.  A long pause.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma pulls back.  Before she can turn, Peter takes her hand, places it over his heart. BA-BOOM, BA-BOOM, BA-BOOM ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Peter touches her hand.  Emma looks into his eyes.  Intrigued but alarmed, disbelief. Peter raises her hand to his lips.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma shudders, battles with herself.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma is tempted, yet filled with terror. 161     CLOSEUP - EMMA'S EYES Inside her pupil -- FLASH CUTS TO: 162     MEMORY FLASHES His face as he kissed her -- his ring on her finger -the visor cracking -- the glass obscuring his face. 163     BACK TO SCENE EMMA Impossible ... how? Peter smiles disarmingly.  As if the answer was obvious.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Peter comes over, folds her in his arms.  Takes her head between his hands.  Emma leans over to him, about to kiss him, both closing their eyes, until -- Lips parted.  Before they kiss, Emma pulls back -- PETER Don't be afraid, darling. She turns, runs to the door.  Like a trapped bird.  She tries the door -- locked.  Another door -- locked.  A window -- locked.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Peter grabs hold of Emma.  She pulls away.  Emma sees his face before her, pleading with her.  Seductive yet nightmarish. As if hallucinating, Emma runs away, towards -- The big window overlooking the gardens.  She runs, leaps, and in SLOW MOTION -- Crashes thru the GLASS, shards and splinters SHATTERING all 'round her, as she -- 164     EXT.  HALLUCINOGEN HALL - WINDOW - DAY somersaults through the window down to the ground.  Lands with a THUD on the wet ground.  Looks up to see -- Steed above her, the STORM RAGING.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She struggles to her feet, comes towards him, upset.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He slugs her and the SCREEN GOES BLACK.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (re: rain) Not again.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's a trap. Tell Mother, beware. Tell Father.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I wouldn't shake that too hard. The weather might turn nasty.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Quite a collection.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) If nature gives a man a collector's mind, it doesn't matter what he collects. Butterflies. Old China. Penny farthings. A true collector grows more obsessive as the years pass.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Your voice -- it's so familiar ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) We have met ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Peter ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I must be dreaming ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Listen... Very much alive.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Darling, it's me...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Peter ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: For you ... all for you ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Don't run away. I forgive you, Emma. I know you left me. But I still love you. Do you still have my ring? I need it.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Steed!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no. First time, shame on you. Third time, shame on me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING (V.O.) Diagnosis confirmed.  Mrs. Peel is suffering from delusions and hallucinations. An extreme personality disorder. She imagines her husband Peter Peel has come back to her ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ON Emma's face.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma's eyes flicker... Steed comes INTO FOCUS, sitting by Emma's bed.  This time he's eating her grapes ... Emma looks around ... Everything blurs.  A STEADY PULSE DRONE.  Tugs at leather straps.  No use.  WIDEN to reveal Emma strapped to a special couch -- Her head surrounded by a plastic dome, terminals and wires leading out into a Dreamscape machine.  Drowsy, disoriented.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Drugged, Emma's eyes drop.  FOCUS CHANGES TO -- 165     ABOVE HER A giant spiral HYPNODISC WHIRRS, creating trippy black and white zig zag op-art effects a la Bridget Riley. She blinks.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING (V.O.) A classic syndrome, to overcome her subconscious guilt at her other crimes. We've attached her to the dreamscape machine. We'll soon see what her unconscious looks like...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Where am I?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The Winslow Home for Retired Lepidoptorists. I'm so sorry I struck you, Mrs. Peel. Please forgive me. I thought you were someone else ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Was I?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (no smile) I expect that's for you to know and me to find out ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It was Peter -- I saw him ...

direction.name: direction

Closes her eyes. 167     EXTREME CLOSEUP ON HER EYES Thousand REMs per sec -- a tiny chip next to her eyes, transmitting out via wires to -- 168     UP ON WALL A "Dreamscape" apparatus like a liquid TV screen flicks thru random images from Emma's unconscious.  Peter Peel -- Teddy Bears -- post card views -- childhood snaps -- 169     BESIDE "BED" Dr. Darling furls his hand over Emma's, his fingers resting upon her ring.  During the interrogation, he soothingly strokes her hand -- tries to remove the ring without arousing her suspicion.  Pulls gently on it. 170     UP IN GALLERY In his wheelchair, Mother sits beside Steed.

direction.name: direction

From a corner of her eye, she sees -- a clip of keys hanging from his pocket. 173     BACK TO SCENE DR. DARLING I want you to say the first thing that comes into your head when I say these words. Do you understand ... ? (as she nods) Blue ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed watching, listening ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The exchange speeds up.  Unknown to Dr. Darling, Emma picks his keys; unlocks her straps.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: As Emma talks, the "Dreamscape" plucks images from her unconscious in trippy psychedelic rush:  faces -- colors -- patterns flash past.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Quietly unclicks a lock.  She stops in mid-gabble.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma unlocks her straps.  Sits Up.  Woozy.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Dr. Darling is shocked, indignant.  Emma rips wires from her body.  The "Dreamscape" machine winds down.  Up in the gallery -- BAM -- !  Mother bashes his metal cane on the railings

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Pushes Dr. Darling aside.

direction.name: direction

They all tumble to the floor, Mother landing perfectly in his wheelchair, Steed effortlessly catching his hat and umbrella.  He moves to Mother -- STEED I think you owe Mrs. Peel an explanation ... Steed stares Mother out.  Who delivers his revelations.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: A turning moment for Emma.  A life lived on a lie.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: touches her ring. 177     BACK TO SCENE Emma looks up at Mother.  A barefaced lie.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed notices Emma touch her ring nervously.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Mother waits.  Emma turns round.  Looks fiercely at him.  Mother shifts uneasily as Emma walks past him to the airlock.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma pushes open the doors.  Walks out.  Down a corridor.  Dr. Darling grabs Mother, as he exits with Steed -- DR. DARLING She must remain here. She's highly dangerous. 178     IN HALL - CONTINUOUS ACTION Mother exits with Steed; they watch Emma going ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Mother wheels himself off.  Then stops; over his shoulder:

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (echoing) What are you trying to do to me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (flailing) We want to help...!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I thought I was a widow. My husband ... the only man I ever loved ... is dead. For the rest of my life I have to live with that.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The death of Peter Peel was a great loss. To us all ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: To you ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Peter Peel was a first class agent. A senior operative.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: department Special operations. He was engaged in top secret research. Top priority.  Government approved.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The Institute ... the funding ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: A cover ... for us. (beat) I'm sorry...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So all that time. Our work, our research was for you ... for this? And the accident -- DARLING It was no accident.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The official investigation ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... was written by me. (beat) It was sabotage, Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Quite frankly ... it could have been you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You're accusing Mrs. Peel of killing her own husband?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Her husband suspected someone very close to the operation. On the day he died, he was setting a test. To prove to himself -- to us that his wife was beyond suspicion. He had to be certain. He said he was going to give Mrs. Peel something ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... I want you to remember. Did Peter give you anything on-that day? 176     CLOSEUP - EMMA

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING He said if it vanished, he'd know it was ... you who betrayed him. He took a huge risk. The ultimate test.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So I'm still ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Under suspicion. Everyone died in the explosion, Mrs. Peel. You were the only survivor ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This is an official matter, Mrs. Peel. No need to take it personally. Where are you going?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: To find out who killed my husband.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The doors and walls are monitored, Mrs. Peel. This is a very secure establishment.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So am I.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Pity. I was growing fond of Mrs. Peel. Unfortunately -- STEED Guilty until proven innocent?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mother and Father know best.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Something quick. Nothing too ... messy.

COUNTRYSIDE - DAY Emma speeds down lanes ... Followed at a safe distance by Steed in his SS100. 181     INT. Sunlight streams through stained glass, illumining Emma as Steed watches her lay -- A red rose by an altar tomb:  an ornate mausoleum two hands clasped in a pose of eternal sleep:  Peter Peel. Emma pauses, as in the b.g., choirboys sing hymn practice.  Steed watches Emma move away, toward the door.  He drops a hymn book.  Emma swivels round -- sees Steed.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma smiles. Then turns, and -- Runs!  Steed follows Emma through a door to -- 186     INT.  CHURCH BELL TOWER - DAY Steed enters, glimpses -- Emma above.  He follows her.  Hears her footsteps.  Trip- trapping up the spiral staircase.  Steed listens, follows. 187     UP BELLTOWER From below, Steed hears a BELL RING.  A FLUTTER of BIRDS.  As debris falls down -- Steed runs up stairs, reaches -- 188     EXT.  BELLTOWER TOP - DAY BELL still RINGING.  At the top, a sheer drop.  Steed edges closer to the ledge. Looks.  A long way down. From behind -- EMMA A long way down. Steed swivels.  Sees Emma blocking his path.  Cool menace.  Steed steps away from the edge, Emma circles him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma steps to the edge.  Steed freezes.  Emma locks down.  Feet resting on the ledge. Rocking to and fro ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed nears her.  Emma pushes herself right to the edge.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed reaches out for her.  Holds out his hand.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed snatches her from the edge, holds her in his arms.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma thinks.  Looks at him.  Deadly serious.  Their eyes lock.  She hesitates, then pecks him on the cheek.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma hesitates.  Then a kiss on the lips.  Longer.  But not much.  Steed grabs her hand, pulls her back.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma harumphs, exasperated.  Moves closer to him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed nods.  Emma leans forward.  A full kiss.  At first reticent ... Emma looks at her watch.  Counts seconds ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Then ... forgets.  Warmer, more relenting.  Edging towards passionate.  They stay embracing for fifteen seconds ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The kiss continues couple of seconds longer.  Before Emma withdraws.  With an effort, she regains her composure.  A long silence.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed savors the kiss.  No reply.  His smile says it all.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed motions down the stairs.  It's close to the edge.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma motions.  Steed goes down, passes close to the edge, and swivels round nervously.  Emma reads his thoughts.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: With this comforting thought, Steed descends first. 189     EXT.  CHURCH TOWER - DAY As Steed and Emma exit from the tower, they see -- A tranquil village scene.  Choirboys walk out from the church.  Nearby in the deserted village street.  A red PHONE BOX.  Which ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (filtered)

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... Sunny intervals leading to sudden storms and gale warnings for all areas. (as he frowns) ... Outbursts of rain, scattered hailstorms and freezing fog greeted the World Council of Ministers as they arrived in London for their conference ...'

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You followed me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Orders.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: To kill me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (fractional pause) Nothing personal.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Careful. You might fall.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I could save you the trouble.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No trouble.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Because you always obey orders ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Always. (pause) Except ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Yes ... ?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... when I don't. It comes down to one thing, Mrs. Peel. Trust.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: And do you trust me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I could be convinced, if ... I knew who poisoned me in the maze. That kiss ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't me; you have my word.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I need proof.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It was longer. On the lips.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Much longer.  Approximately ... fifteen seconds.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... Ready?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... Four ... seven ... ni-...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (aroused) Mmm ... what are you doing?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Keeping a stiff upper lip?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Is that all?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: So I'm in the clear?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: But you did suspect me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Not for a moment.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You're playing games.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Aren't we all, Mrs. Peel?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I thought you played by the rules.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I thought you didn't.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm playing to win.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Winning isn't everything.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Please don't tell me it's how you play the game.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (smiles; stands aside) After you -- Mrs. Peel ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No, after you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (back to square one) You don't trust me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: As far as you trust me.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: When it happens, Steed, you'll be the first to know ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ... Starts to RING.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who could that be?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: of THUNDER.  Steed looks up: a clear sky.  He's puzzled.  Suddenly suspicious.  As Emma moves to the phone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He pulls her back.  Emma looks at him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: RING-RING ... Another ROLL of THUNDER.  Steed connects the two as -- an angelic CHOIRBOY walks towards the phone ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No -- don't answer it ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: That's it. The phones trigger the explosions --

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ... A LOUDER ROLL of THUNDER.  As the Choirboy nears the

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed shouts -- STEED Don't -- don't answer it -- ! 190     CLOSEUP - PHONE RING-RING -- the PHONE in the f.g. as the choirboy closes in, opens the door -- 191     INSIDE PHONE BOX The door shuts.  Noise muffled.  The Choirboy can't hear Steed and Emma's shouted warnings, as he lifts his hand up, and -- 192     OUTSIDE Steed sees him reach out, warns the vicar and choirboys.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed and Emma, all the choirboys hit the dirt, as 193     INSIDE PHONE BOX The Choirboy grabs the phone, and lifts it up, and Silence. No explosion.  A few seconds pass.  Steed and everyone are down on the ground.  As they see -- 194     FROM PHONE BOX -- the Choirboy leaves the phone hanging.  He gets out, scans the crowd.  Then walks calmly over to Steed, who's still prone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The vicar and choirboys look on sympathetically, as -- Steed dusts himself off.  Emma and everyone gets up.  Steed goes to the phone box, takes the call.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: His expression changes as he listens.  Emma goes to the phone box as Steed rings off. He emerges from the box.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Get down -- get down -- it's going to explode -- !

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's your mother.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mother? How did you find me?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I told Mother I took care of you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You lied.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I equivocated. But you're not their big worry at present. It's Dr. Darling:  he's disappeared ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma's reaction to this news -- 195     INT.  HALLUCINOGEN HALL - DAY Inside the upper room, in front of a mirror -- With his back turned to us.  Dr. Darling holds something in his hand, and waits as -- 196     DOWN LONG HALL Bad "Emma" walks over.  She stands in front of him. Blank expression.  Dr. Darling hardly even looks up.  With her hair up, we recognize on her neck a tattoo:  Z424.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: which he grips tightly. As -- 198     IN MIRROR a metamorphosis.  His features melt and bubble, a mask of plastic surgery and it's slipping around like Michael Jackson's face under kleig lights.  He adjusts it, then ... Shakes the snowshaker ... 199     EXT.  COUNTRYSIDE - DAY THUNDER as the sky darkens -- PAN DOWN to reveal: Steed's Jag, zooming through country lanes.  Rain starts. 200     INT.  JAG - DAY Steed driving, winces with the drizzle.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed thinks; sighs.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Through a door marked "Information & Counter Espionage" -- -- walks Steed with another man in identical clothes:  dapper Savile Row suit, umbrella and bowler.  Which is Emma Peel, in disguise.  Steed furtively checks passers-by.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: At a door marked "Information -- Col. I. Jones." Steed knocks, opens the door for her.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma goes in as Steed walks down the corridor. 202     INT.  MINISTRY OFFICE - DAY A room full of archives and files.  Emma walks through tall corridors, stacks of cabinets full of old paper. Dusty, musty and mildewing.  Long forgotten.  Nobody there.  Suddenly Emma hears -- FOOTSTEPS. She follows them.  Round stacks, round corners.  The FOOTSTEPS get LOUDER. She's closing in.  The FOOTSTEPS get LOUDER, until up ahead of her -- A filing cabinet drawer opens up.  On its own. Emma watches as a file pops up, floats through air.  The drawer slams shut.  Still nobody there.  Emma follows the file to a -- Desk.  Emma watches as -- the chair swivels round.  The file pages open up.  Then the phone lifts up by itself, a voice:

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma looks ahead of her.  To the chair. As -- A desk drawer opens up, a pipe is whisked through the air, a match is struck.  The pipe lights; smoke belches forth.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed on the phone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: File pages flip through the air as Jones goes through them.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma is surprised.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed enters behind them on the run -- STEED We must hurry, Mrs. Peel ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed proffers an arm to Emma.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She decides, takes his arm.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The A-team is born.  Steed and Emma tip their hats to Jones. 205     EXT.  LONDON STREETS - SEVERAL ANGLES - NIGHT Troops rushing in to take up defense positions.  Searchlights pierce the cloudy sky.  A protective ring of hardware surrounds the hall. 206     INT.  MOTHER'S 22 BUS (AKA INSIDE MOBILE HQ) - NIGHT At the controls, Brenda looks on.  She hands a bag of jelly babies to Mother.  Who picks out his favorites, as he gives a briefing to Father and others, sitting in passenger seats -- ORDERS BARKED OUTSIDE as -- MOTHER Inside that hall are some of the Most powerful figures in the world. Tight security. Our only option.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Brenda glances over at Father's imperturbable face. As -- 207     EXT.  PALACE (WESTMINSTER) - NIGHT Wind picking up.  Outside the grand palace hall for the reception of the World Council of Ministers, guards stand on duty.  Barriers, flashing lights.  Nobody gets past, except -- 208     INT.  PALACE (WESTMINSTER) - NIGHT Up in the gallery, Steed and Emma enter through a secret passage behind a painting. He with bowler and umbrella.  She in black leather and boots.  They find themselves in a niche and freeze, very close to one another.  Steed sniff s ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: He fumbles with a bulging jacket pocket

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She leads the way through marble halls, arched galleries, red velvet carpets, glittering chandeliers.  From the hall, a SPEECH ECHOES:

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed checks out his own.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: . DARLING We are in the final phase. I shall require you to be especially obedient. There must be no failures. 197     CLOSEUP - IN HIS HANDS - SNOWSHAKER

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Drat. Someone wants to implicate you in this affair, Mrs. Peel. Any idea who?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No idea who. No idea why ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (thinks) Teddy bears, cuckoo clocks, toys All children's things ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: ... Or grown-ups, who still like to be children.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Quite. Any childhood friends? Enemies?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Not to speak of. Peter and I were both loners. There was nobody.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Very well. I have a friend who might be of assistance. He's at the Ministry. We'd better be careful.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'm a wanted woman, I know ... 201     INT.  MINISTRY CORRIDORS - DAY

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: His name's Jones. 'Invisible' Jones.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Why's he called 'Invisible'?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You'll find out.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Aren't you coming?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'll catch you up. Don't worry; he's expecting you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Tell Miss Proudfoot, no calls. (beat) Colonel Jones at your service, Mrs. Peel. Just a moment --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Talk to the pipe, Mrs. Peel. That usually helps. Don't worry about me being invisible. Other than that I'm perfectly normal.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I see.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Or rather, you don't. Learnt the tricks in camouflage. Till this accident made a prang of things. How can I help you, Mrs. Peel? 203     INT.  MINISTRY - ANOTHER OFFICE

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I say, Trubshaw, Steed here ... Barometer's falling fast. Mrs. Peel and I find ourselves in need of foul weather gear. (beat) Yes, I'd say gentlemen's snuff for starters. And then -- 204     INT.  INVISIBLE JONES' OFFICE

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Ah, here we are. Steed asked me to play a hunch:  Valentine Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Peter's brother?  But -- INVISIBLE JONES (V.O.) Half-brother to be precise.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Now let's see ... Eton, Cambridge ... research into robotics and plastics. Overtaken by Peter's work on the physics of climate change ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I know all this.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Do you also know that during your final experiment, your halfbrother- in-law was under surveillance?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Surveillance? By whom?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Father. She gave him an 'all clear' after a security test by Dr. Darling.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Who's now vanished.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Makes two of us.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Are you suggesting that Dr. Darling and Valentine were somehow in this together? But that's absurd.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Hurry?  What for?  I'm just now -- STEED You didn't tell her?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (testy) I was getting to it.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Getting to what?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The World Council of Ministers meets tomorrow to convene the new global defense initiative -- EMMA I fail to see -- STEED There's a reception this evening. Colonel Jones thinks it advisable we attend.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Have we been invited?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (poker-voiced) Under the circumstances Mother didn't see fit, but I think I can get you in ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (surveys her male outfit) Well, I can't possibly go like this.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I had a feeling. That's why we're in a hurry ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: May I have the honor, Mrs. Peel?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You may, Mr. Steed.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'll see to it personally.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What's that you're wearing?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's called Black Leather.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Intoxicating. Here, have one of these.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What is it?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Limpet bomb. Small, very compact. From Trubshaw's.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (hocks it on belt) When all this is over, we simply must get you out of that suit.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You first.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Shall we?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ... In the uncertain climate that threatens this global initiative, no magic umbrella can shield us.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Only our own vigilance. Security and stability are our watchwords.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: . Steed pauses, offers Emma a small silver box.  Inside...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Steed takes some; Emma follows his example.  Weird.  Does it make you high?  They walk on, open doors to -- 209     INT.  PALACE HALLWAY - NIGHT An empty gallery.  Steed and Emma peer down at a -- 210     MARBLE HALLWAY A black and white floor.  Butlers move across like surreal chess pieces.  Otherwise, empty.  A chamber ensemble plays "The Merry Widow" waltz, which floats through empty halls.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: They move cautiously forward as 211     EXT.  LONDON STREETS - NIGHT Outside, snow begins to fall.  Trees and buildings shimmer under a light layer of white. A Christmassy glow -- Even troops play with snowflakes, until -- 212     SEVERAL ANGLES The wind rises.  The snow falls harder. 213     INT.  PALACE - NIGHT Down in the hallway, Steed and Emma search for the Ministers.  They head down a corridor, then hear a NOISE.  They hide behind pillers. As -- Butlers walk past in military file, carrying elaborate displays of lobster and meats. Steed steals -- A chicken leg.  Nibbles on it.  Suddenly another door opens -- Emma hides.  Steed looks up to see -- Father "staring" at him.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma in hiding, listens as -- FATHER (O.S.) You disobeyed an order, Steed. Mrs. Peel is dangerous; she cannot be trusted. Emma looks out the window behind her; eyes widen ... back to -- STEED (O.S.) I think she can. (beat) Can you? Emma is deeply affected by Steed's choice. Father's face, meantime, has turned to stone.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She turns, almost walks into the door as she slips away. Emma returns as the ALARM is raised -- STEED Bad news. Father's looking for you. Where are those bloody ministers?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: She leads him to the window:  sure enough -- heavy snow. Steed reacts, eyes wide.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The blizzard rages through streets -- Now impassable.  Snow drifts block roads.  White mountains of snow start to climb up shop fronts.  And amid the sky -- Filled with snowflakes, up round the roofs, a purple cloud descends on unsuspecting troops -- 215     INT.  PALACE - NIGHT Steed returns, rushes across the marble halls -- To Emma. But up ahead, sees -- 216     STEED'S POV - FROM WINDOWS A purple fog seeping into the hallway, billowing through the corridors as -- 217     INT.  PALACE ANTEROOM - NIGHT Inside an anteroom, like a Roman arena -- marble pillars, red carpet, golden walls, ceiling murals -- The World Council ministers assemble:  slick pin-striped suits or African robes, Chinese Mao-suits, Indian Nehru-jackets, all distinguished men and women, surrounded by -- Fussing officials, minor dignitaries, and butlers, bowing and weaving a web of diplomatic protocol, interrupted by -- 218     CENTER OF HALL The sight of Emma Peel in black leather. She strides into the room.  Picks a glass of champagne from a passing butler.  All stare, Emma raises her glass -- EMMA Gentlemen, ladies. Forgive the breach of protocol. An emergency -- From the hallway -- BOOM -- !  The door bursts open, Emma is blown over by the blast as the purple cloud races inside. 219     SEVERAL ANGLES as the smoke furls around the ministers, they choke, fall. From the doors -- Steed leaps in, gives Emma another snort of snuff -- STEED Quick --it'll protect you -- Emma inhales.  Now immune to the gas, Steed and Emma hear -- CRASH -- !  They see -- through thick cloud -a mysterious man in a white lab coat, wearing a gas mask, leading a group of butlers, all in gas masks -- heads like black flies -- in formation round the ministers, helpless on the floor.  A kidnapping -- The man and butlers haul away several ministers, and -- Escape from the rear doors.  The butlers form a guard to protect the man. Steed and Emma run after them.  More butlers pursue. 220     EXT.  PALACE - NIGHT As troops roll helplessly in the snow-covered purple haze, the butlers load the ministers onto waiting choppers as -- 221     INT.  MOTHER'S HQ - CONTINUOUS ACTION Mother, Brenda, et al choke on purple smoke in the bus ... 222     INT.  PALACE HALLWAY - NIGHT Behind pillars, Steed and Emma hide as -- Butlers in gas masks patrol the halls.  A butler passes them without noticing.  They try to emerge.  But another patrols -- Steed trips the butler with his umbrella, then chops him down on the ground.  He rises but Emma kicks him into as -- Behind them Steed sees the lab-coated man escape up the stairs, protected by a posse of butlers.  He shouts -- STEED After him, Mrs. Peel! A whole posse of butlers then advances.  Steed faces them.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma hesitates.  Then turns, heads for an ornate dual shaft elevator.  She bangs the button, gets inside, doors shut, as the BULLETS from MACHINE-GUNNING gas masked butlers strike the brass door as -- Steed whips his rapier from his umbrella and duels with the butlers.  To give Emma time, he uses every trick and prop at his disposal, plus, brute force to -- Kick, chop, punch, and impale them into submission, as -- 223     EXT.  ELEVATOR (UPPER FLOORS) - CONTINUOUS ACTION The posse of butlers fan out on to keep pace with Emma.  They head upstairs, pressing elevator "CALL" buttons on every floor, as -- 224     INSIDE ELEVATOR Emma waits inside.  Until she reaches -- 225     EXT.  ELEVATOR (2ND FLOOR) - CONTINUOUS ACTION Doors open.  A HAIL of BULLETS hit the lift as Emma hides to one side until the doors close. 226     INT.  ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS ACTION Emma sighs with relief.  COOL HUM as the ELEVATOR rises. 227     ON STAIRS - MEANWHILE Steed gaining on the butlers, heading for the stairs, as -- 228     INT. ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS ACTION At the next floor, the doors open -- Two butlers rush inside.  BLAM -- !  Emma cuts one in the throat with an elbow punch,  then -- Punches -- kicks -- stabs the other butler, a more brutish type, who recovers enough to grab Emma by the throat. She chokes, breaks his stranglehold, swerves him round, gains a nelson hold on his arms and throat -- And a knee in his back in time for -- PING!  The BELL RINGS at -- 3rd floor where -- Emma spins her captive butler round, in time to face -- Whooomph!  a blast of fire from -- A flamethrower launched in the hall. Aaargh -- !  The butler gets fried, but -- 229     EXT.  ELEVATOR (3RD FLOOR) - CONTINUOUS ACTION Shields Emma from the worst of the blast. She  hurls him clear of the doors, which -- 230     INT.  ELEVATORS - CONTINUOS ACTION Slam shut.  COOL HUM ... 231     EXT.  PALACE MAIN FLOOR - CONTINUOUS ACTION Steed continues his one-sided duel with the other butlers, skewering madly, trying to get upstairs to help Emma... 232     INT.  ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS ACTION Up Emma goes.  Looks for an escape route.  Bangs on the walls.  No trap doors.  No secret panels.  The "floor" light flickers between floors. Waiting, until ... 233     EXT.  ELEVATOR (4TH FLOOR) - CONTINUOUS ACTION The doors open.  A grenade is hurled inside the doors, it rolls to one corner, Emma dives to the other side, then -- Scrambles for the grenade.  Picks it up.  It slips out of her hands.  Scrambles more.  It slips out ... Just beyond the elevator doors.  Which start to shut.  Emma leans out a foot, kicks the grenade towards the butlers, and -- As her elevator doors close -- BOOM -- !  It EXPLODES among the butlers, one of whom -- Rushes to -- 234     ELEVATOR (5TH FLOOR) - CONTINUOUS ACTION Where he waits for the elevator.  Removes pin.  Grenade ready.  The light PINGS. Doors open.  About to throw it inside, when -- 235     BUTLER'S POV No Emma. 236     BACK TO SCENE The butler hesitates.  Looks inside.  Still no Emma?  He wonders what to do, and -- The doors shut; he jams his foot.  The doors open again.  He moves in -- 237     INT.  ELEVATOR - CONTINUOUS ACTION -- and looks round.  Nobody there.  Until, as we -- PULL BACK UP to reveal -- FROM ABOVE, spread-eagled like an X on the elevator roof, limbs flexed against the walls is -- Emma, who -- drops down and -- Scissors the butler's head between her legs. The grenade rolls free ... Emma twists around, grabs his ears, and -- Sits on his face.  Buries his head in her crotch.  A muffled sound from the guy, until -- Emma scissor kicks, breaking his neck.  She drags -- 238     EXT.  ELEVATOR (67H FLOOR) - CONTINUOUS ACTION His head out.  Leaving his neck between the doors.  So as she leaps out, heads up for the stairs, the elevators doors.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Trubshaw again? What now?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Snuff. (off Emma's lock) I must insist you try some.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: They're playing your song, Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (annoyed) 'The Merry Widow?' I might have known. Where's the reception?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Oh, hello ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: We want Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Dead, I'm afraid.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I shall summon security.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Have a look at this.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It's almost May, for heaven sake. 214     EXT.  LONDON STREETS - NIGHT

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Go -- !

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: ! And -- BOOM!  His GRENADE rocks the elevator, which 239     INT.  ELEVATOR SHAFT - ABOVE AND BELOW - CONTINUOUS ACTION Breaks from its ropes, and -- Plummets down the elevator shaft, shaking the building as it crashes -- 240     INT.  PALACE STAIRS - CONTINUOUS ACTION Everything shakes with the impact of the elevator as Steed battles his way up, step by step, throwing gas-masked butlers over his shoulder as he struggles... 241     INT.  PALACE ATTIC - NIGHT Up the winding staircase, at the top, a skylight, which -- Flips open.  The man leaps out, throwing back inside a smoke grenade, and locks the skylight.  As the grenade -- 242     INT.  NARROW STAIRCASE BOOM!  explodes in the narrow staircase, fills it with purple smoke.  Emma rushes thru smoke, choking.  She gets to the skylight, tries to open it -- locked. A moment's panic.  Then Emma -- punches a hole in the glass, flicks the switch, flips the skylight up, and -- Emerges into the night air.  Snowflakes tumble around her. 243     EXT.  ROOFTOP - HELIPAD - NIGHT Blades whirling.  Amid the blizzard, the man ready to escape in a super-fab streamlined whirly chopper ... Another assassin attacks Emma, pins her on her back, overlooking the city.  Stands up before her -- Emma held back over gargoyle, over now snow white city ...  Knees assassin in balls. Flicks him backwards ... As his body hurtles down into the snow-covered streets, Emma rushes forward. But too late:  sees -- The chopper -- about to take off. 244     FROM INSIDE CHOPPER The gas-masked MAN in the white lab coat:

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The chopper rises slowly. Emma looks.  A fifteen foot leap ... Impossible. 246     FROM INSIDE CHOPPER A farewell wave from the gas-masked man. 247     CLOSEUP - EMMA contemplating the jump, beneath falling snowflakes, as the distance grows. 248     EMMA'S POV The rope/chain ladder coils into the chopper's belly. 249     INT.  CHOPPER - NIGHT Above London rooftops, after dark -- The man (still wears gas mask) the Pilot, CO-PILOT and a Butler (ditto).  From the chopper, a giddy look down thru a glass command module.  A fairy tale, snow white city.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Goodbye, Mrs. Peel! 245     EXT.  ROOFTOP

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: the RADIO, interference.  A changing of stations.  Then a CRACKLY broadcast of "The Merry Widow." As the WALTZ serenades them high above the city  -- a KNOCKING from outside on the door -- Surprised reactions.  The Butler opens the door, sees -- Emma hanging onto the helicopter struts.  The Butler is too dumbstruck to say anything.

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: Emma grabs his epauletted shoulder, yanks him up, flicks him out -- The Butler is jerked out -- flies into the open air.  Emma watches him fall ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The white-coated Man moves forward, but Emma is out, slamming the door, still clinging ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: The Pilot nods, works controls, the chopper dips as -- Blam -- !  a kinky leather boot crashes -- Into the Pilot's face as Emma kicks in the GLASS from the front of the chopper,

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (shouts, re:  the gas mask) Anyone ever tell you you look like a housefly?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Anyone else need a lift?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (to Pilot; intercom) Can't you throw her off?

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: so the Pilots can't see -- a sudden rush of cold air -- The INSTRUMENT PANELS WHIRR round as the Pilots struggle for control -- VOICE (V.O.) (intercom) Where'd she go? 250     EXT.  CHOPPER TOP - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT with the blades whirling directly over her head, Emma crawls over the top of the chopper and lets herself down the other side as London's lights twinkle beneath ... As the Co-Pilot pokes his head out of the cockpit -- Emma grabs him with one hand, hoists him up into the air -- The Co-Pilot dangles over the city.  Grabs Emma.  Slithers back onto the cockpit. Pistol whips her.  Emma crunches back onto the metal.  Blades whirring close! The co-Pilot peers into her eyes from inside the gas mask -- CO-PILOT Happy landings, Mrs. Peel. He raises his hand, ready to hit her again, Emma yanks him up, where his head get sliced off by the blades -- body and head fall away separately ... As Emma reacts, her legs are grabbed from below and the white-coated Man pulls her down the side of the chopper -- Emma falls, but manages a flying handhold, hangs onto the chain wire below the chopper.  As -- 251     EXT.  WIDE ANGLE - NIGHT The Pilot and his passenger zoom at low level over buildings.  Trying to dislodge Emma ... 252     THEIR POV Thru the blizzard, zooming down streets, landmark buildings looming up topped in snow, feet up ... shinnying up the chain wire ...

direction.name: direction
direction.raw_text: no longer heard as old record or ensemble arrangement but enormous, for FULL ORCHESTRA ... 253     CLOSEUP - EMMA grimly hoists herself up along the struts again, hand over hand, coming up to the cockpit from behind -- 254     BACK TO SCENE With a sudden movement, she yanks the Pilot out from behind and he goes flying towards eternity on his own. The chopper out of control as the white-coated Man is left to fly it himself ... 255     IN NIGHT AIR "THE MERRY WIDOW" BOOMS, the chopper lurches, spinning round -- up and down, over spiraling corkscrews, an insane waltz ... 256     INT.  CHOPPER - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT The white-coated Man gets control ... 257     EXT.  CHOPPER - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT Zig-zags down a narrow street, trying to smash Emma into sides of windows. 258     SEVERAL ANGLES as Emma bounces of buildings, holding on for dear life ... 259     EXT.  WIDE ANGLE OVER THAMES - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT The chopper dips down, dragging Emma through icy water ... Up ahead ... Tower Bridge ... twin peaks ... a firework display going on ... rockets and lights in the sky thru snowflakes ... Emma sees the bridge coming, reaches down and -- 260     CLOSEUP SHOT Detaches her pocket limpet bomb and lobs it into the chopper cockpit. 261     HER POV The bridge looms up, chopper rising to cross it as Emma leaps onto the bridge! 262     INT.  CHOPPER - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT The Man sees the bomb ... Also flings himself onto the bridge as -- Against b.g. of the fireworks display -- 263     WIDE ANGLE - TOWER BRIDGE - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT BOOM! -- the CHOPPER EXPLODES.  Ball of flames.  The crowd roars in appreciation ... great fireworks! 264     EXT.  TOP OF TOWER BRIDGE WALKWAY - CONTINUOUS ACTION - NIGHT Emma picks herself up, sees the Man in the white lab coat and runs for him. He runs too -- towards -- 265     ANOTHER CHOPPER which unloads a rope ladder as Emma puts on every ounce of steam ... dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Steed

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How did you guess?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You reek of Mrs. Peel's Black Leather ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: It was you who gave Valentine Peel his security clearance ... you're the mole who betrayed the Ministry.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Mother betrayed me. She was going to replace me with a younger Father.  Errand boy that's all I was. 'Find Steed...'

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Well, you found me. Have a sniff of this, why don't you? Careful, the scent can be overpowering ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: People expect weather to be free. They're used to it. I call that a denial of freedom. No freedom of choice. An abuse of human rights. They buy water, electricity, gas. Why shouldn't they be able to buy their own weather if they want to? If they have a little incentive ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Such as?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Destruction of their local weather systems. I can zap a thousand Chernobyls into the air.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The result would be ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Chaos. Transport paralysis. Crop failure.  Economic disaster. Frostbite or sunburn ... on a massive scale. You've seen a few samples...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Then what's stopping you?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: One very small thing. A diamond 'cyclone' chip. A thousand times more information on a fraction of the size. If I possess that, my powers would be unlimited. My dear half-brother was developing it. But he suspected sabotage. He gave the chip to ... you, 'Mrs.' Peel. I want you. But also your ring.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: How Wagnerian ... Do you mean to say you've waited all these years because you couldn't create a chip on your own? That would have amused Peter.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Speaking of Peter, there's more good news: You won't even have to change your last name. You'll always be Mrs. Peel.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: What are my choices?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Choices?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I'll never marry you.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: This little toy gave me back my face. It can replace yours. What do you think? Medusa? Madame Defarge? Maggie Thatcher?

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Dr. Darling, this is Father. We have an intruder. I repeat --

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Ah. That will be Steed. He followed you. Please excuse me. I have work to do. My most spectacular performance. A ballet of clouds. It was made for you. I want to give you a heart, Emma. I want all of London to see it. And now with this ... (flourishes ring) They will. (leans close) And for an encore: the biggest cyclone in history will wipe the City from the face of the earth. (winks) Shape of things to come, my darling.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Blast. What to do? Mrs. Peel!

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: The things I do for England ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You must let me go ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Don't you understand? If he has me, he'll have no use for you ... he'll destroy you ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: No...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Someone's going to pay for this.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You're better than I expected.

dialogue.raw_text: I was at Harrow ...

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Bang-bang ... you're dead.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: One shot -- for emergencies.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (clutches wound) That's not playing by the rules.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (echoes Emma!) Rules are made to be broken.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: (pulls his own gun) If you say so.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: I do.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: You said ... one shot.

dialogue.name: dialogue
dialogue.raw_text: Did I? My mistake.
